oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Mickey Gilley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Mickey Gilley (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Recording is from March 05, 1985.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Mickey Gilley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones and background noises can be heard -- (01:03) Mickey Gilley and Ralph Emery clear their throats before addressing the audience and Gilley's U.S.O. Show -- (02:38) Emery invited Gilley to reflect on the attitude of the military members -- (06:03) Emery questions whether or no Gilley brings his piano with him to the U.S.O. shows -- (07:02) Emery invites Gilley to discuss his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame -- (09:45) Emery and Gilley talk about the venue Gilley chose for his CBS live album -- (12:21) Emery invites Galley to reflect on how audiences react when they understand they are being recorded -- (13:36) Emery and Gilley reflect on how close Gilley was to recording with Jerry Lee Louis -- (16:58) Gilley reflects on Jimmy Swaggart and his chance to perform on Swaggart's show -- (19:10) Emery praises Gilley for his honesty -- (20:43) Emery inquires about where Gilley lives and the yard work he performs -- (22:49) Gilley reflects on his family; including his rock musician son -- (24:51) Emery attempts to recall Billy Joel and Gilley praises him -- (25:27) Emery inquires about Gilley's favorite country musicians -- (27:17) Emery leads Gilley to a story about a club's piano and Louis -- (29:28) Gilley reflects on his difference in success from Louis -- (33:53) Emery and Gilley discuss the change that Urban Cowboy made in Gilley's career -- (36:19) Emery asks Gilley about the sales on mechanical bulls -- (38:23) Gilley tells about the times fans attempted to get on stage, and working with Charly McClain -- (39:26) Gilley talks about his pilot license and flying a plane -- (41:30) Emery inquires about the costs of maintenance for Gilley's plane -- (44:33) Emery and Gilley recall the time Emery and Conway Twitty lit Gilley's piano on fire -- (46:32) Emery, Gilley and a couple unknown voices continue to discuss the piano incident away from the microphones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Gilley, Mickey;
